com.gotenna.sdk.connection

Class GTConnectionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gotenna.sdk.connection.GTConnectionManager

  • public final class GTConnectionManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A singleton that handles scanning for and connecting to the goTenna.

    Created on 6/7/18.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  GTConnectionManager.GTConnectionListener
      Interface definition for a callback to be invoked when the connection state to the goTenna changes.
      static interface  GTConnectionManager.GTDeviceTypeChangedListener 
      static interface  GTConnectionManager.NrfDiscoveryListener

      • getCommandMode

        public com.gotenna.sdk.data.CommandMode getCommandMode()

      • getConnectedGotennaAddress

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String getConnectedGotennaAddress()
        When you connect to a goTenna for the first time, it will remember the hardware address of that specific goTenna and will not connect to any other goTenna devices.
        Returns:
        The hardware address of the goTenna

      • clearConnectedGotennaAddress

        public void clearConnectedGotennaAddress()
        Clears the remembered goTenna hardware address, allowing you to connect to other goTenna devices.

      • scanAndConnect

        public void scanAndConnect()
        If Bluetooth is enabled, will scan for a goTenna in the area and attempt to connect to it. If this device has connected to a goTenna before, it may specifically look for that goTenna.

        You can determined if we have connected to a goTenna before by using getConnectedGotennaAddress() You can also clear a remembered goTenna by calling clearConnectedGotennaAddress()

      • scanAndConnect

        public void scanAndConnect(@NonNull
                           GTDeviceType deviceType)
        If Bluetooth is enabled, will scan for a goTenna in the area and attempt to connect to it. If this device has connected to a goTenna before, it may specifically look for that goTenna.

        You can determined if we have connected to a goTenna before by using getConnectedGotennaAddress() You can also clear a remembered goTenna by calling clearConnectedGotennaAddress()

        Parameters:
        deviceType - Indicate which goTenna device you wish to scan for.

      • hasUSBSupport

        public boolean hasUSBSupport()

      • isUSBGoTennaAttached

        public boolean isUSBGoTennaAttached()

      • stopScan

        public void stopScan()
        Stops actively scanning for goTenna devices.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnects from the goTenna if connected.

      • disconnectWithRetry

        public void disconnectWithRetry()
        Disconnects from the goTenna if connected and starts to scan again.

      • writeCommand

        public void writeCommand(com.gotenna.sdk.data.GTCommand command)

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Determines if we are currently connected to the goTenna or not.
        Returns:
        True if we are connected, false otherwise.

      • addGtConnectionListener

        public void addGtConnectionListener(@NonNull
                                    GTConnectionManager.GTConnectionListener gtConnectionListener)
        Adds a GTConnectionManager.GTConnectionListener to listen for and receive updates about goTenna connection state changes.
        Parameters:
        gtConnectionListener - The listener to receive the callback updates.

      • removeGtConnectionListener

        public void removeGtConnectionListener(@NonNull
                                       GTConnectionManager.GTConnectionListener gtConnectionListener)
        Removes a GTConnectionManager.GTConnectionListener to no longer listen for and receive updates about goTenna connection state changes.
        Parameters:
        gtConnectionListener - The listener to receive the callback updates.

      • getGtConnectionState

        public GTConnectionState getGtConnectionState()
        Determines the current connection state to the goTenna.
        Returns:
        The current connection state.
